title: Banned
body: So i have dumped over 1k real money on champions and skins for this game. I was banned today for 15 days for being toxic. I was banned for calling out people for mistakes and them flaming for it. If you have gone through anything like this or anything similar and have been banned for it plz upvote this. I was banned for calling out mistakes from other players and defending myself from their flame for doing so. apparently in "riots" society everyone is perfect exepect for the angry people. I'm sorry i'm triggered for having 3 games with teammates that auto pilot and have no idea what is going on throughout the match. myb for callling them out and trying to find a new game in "norms" (ffing early) to actually improve over trying to constantly play from behind in bronze. I see shit from 10 mins ago and call it out. but i'm flamed and reported for it. Thanks riot for treating your $1400+ deep fan so generously! ( looking at the chat log i don't see where the fuck i was toxic.) sure i called people out on shit but i'm banned for doing that. so pretty much if you play league don't talk to anyone unless it's game related? i'm hella triggererd thanks riot. Plx respond

replies.body: The amount of money you spend in the game is irrelevant. You're still subject to the same rules as everyone else.

The point isn't even about spending money. It's that I'm getting permantely punished for trying to call out mistakes. sure i may come off toxic sometimes. but if i'm getting banned for calling out mistakes that means that people can't handle constructive criticism. When I ask someone why they are taking my farm when i'm Adc If they are jg and they have a full jg spawned, am I wrong? If i'm not pinging for assistance and my jglr is coming to my lane with a mission to feed his/her ass off (not intentionally/or intentionally) do I say nothing to correct that? is this what league is? where you have no opinion and everything is fucking pc like south park? is this real life like not a prank?
Edit: And if it's a fucking crime to call anyone out on mistakes please let me fucking know so i can quit this game and go back to WoW. Like I said I called out people on mistakes and because they were probably (duo queue) I get fucked for the reports. thanks. I served 3 years in the US army to call out mistakes and shit and people get butt hurt. Feelsfucking goodman. when I suck dick I know I suck and i feel bad. but damn i guess i'm the only one who loves getting carried and not having to fucking try hard to win a game when your teammates are doing everything in their fucking power to make you lose. like come on riiot watch replays if you need to. FUUUUUCK i'm hella triggered that i'm banned. I admit yeah i was toxic but too some fucking 3rd graders or what? wtf!!

You're perfectly allowed to give **constructive** criticism. You aren't allowed to "call out" others or harass or berate them for their mistakes.

It doesn't matter if you think they're bad - they may think the same about you, but nobody deserves to be flamed. And that's honestly what most "calling out mistakes" is - just blaming and flaming.

Keep in mind after this 14 day ban ends you are on very thin ice. Any instance of negativity has the potential to result in a permanent ban on your account.

you know what, you are totally right. And I guess i'll just wait those 14 days. But foreal though i do try my best. But when you play over 5 games a day that shit drains you. and you notices wins and losses. I do agree you should never surrender in ranked. But put yourself in my shoes. if you're in a 2-3 loss streak in ranked , are you not tilted?

The only thing I can add is that as others have said the only common factor in all of your games is you. If you take the time you're trying to teach others, and instead use that time to try and focus on your own gameplay, you may very well find it's easier to win games. You can't control others, and you can't make them better, and you'll probably never see them again. So why does it matter?

If I'm in a losing streak, I walk away from the game and do something else because I know if I lose the 4th or 5th that there's a really big chance I'll tilt and do things I don't normally do.

To be honest and real with you though: You are the only common factor in your losses. Champs, bans/picks, summoners , opponents and allies change each game, but you don't. The only way to improve is to improve yourself. You honestly can't "magically" change someone else's skill level in your games, but you can change yours.

Vol you got to ask yourself is in game really the right time to do this? 

Most humans have a tough time with constructive criticism when they timing is good and the know and on some level trust the person giving the criticism. 

None of what I mentioned is in okay during a LoL game. 

Here is the only situation where it could potentially work:
1. You are asked directly in game. 
2. You are ask directly post game. 

The takeaway is don't do that unless asked for and even when asked you should consider if it's worth it. 

Hopefully you learn from this.

It really depends on how you gave this "constructive criticism". Because there is a difference between:
"Hey I need this farm for lane, please don't tax."
And
"Fuck off, this is my farm, go do your jungle pos."
If the point isn't about spending money, why did you keep on bringing up how much money you spent?

If you want us to review your punishment, then please post your chatlogs. If not, I think it'll be safe for us to assume that your are like those toxic jerks out there, harassing/insulting others consistently.

calling out mistakes can be seen as negative or harassment depending on how it is done. it is better to make gentle suggestions or stay quiet. also if you defended yourself with flame language then you are just as eligible to get a ban as them..

chat logs otherwise nobody can really judge.and money has no influence, punishments are all about behavior in game

Whelp, just wanted to see how many people hit no, so why not and low and behold I'm the 1st no to 44 yes,woo, I regret something, anyway

Nobody likes a coach yelling at you about all your mistakes during the game, it just feels bad,puts unnecessary stressful pressure on them and they tend to break,fall apart, tilt harder as they too are about to explode and quit as their heads not in the game and generally don't want to even acknowledge/avoid your prescence at all,very few ever play a 10x times better in situations like that.

If you gonna coach them tell em in the pregame lobby what the basic fundamentals of the plan is and signals in the game  while having back ups and motivation, and after game what your thoughts and performance could be worked upon out there while giving them hope, and respect what pride they have left also what they did good on in game.

Just remember, you are judged on your behavior and they are judged on theirs. If you flamed someone out of defense of getting flamed yourself... since you flamed, you are going to get punished because there are better ways to handle getting flamed. Try to keep a calmer head. Remember to never hit enter if you're typing because you're angry, vindictive, upset, wanting to hurt someone's feelings, say something sarcastic, passive aggressive, homophobic, sexist, racist, bigoted, or otherwise be negative to your teammates.

You can handle toxicity by not being toxic back to that player and that tends to yield better results. Deescalating situations is highly preferred by all players over escalating the situation by being toxic back. 

If they're being toxic, let them dig their own grave and report them at the end of the game and walk away from that game with a clean slate.
